reviewText:
It's a thumbs up from me. Barely. Not a great game, but a decent one. The good outweighs the bad, but not by much. A flawed gem that should be purchased on sale (which given it's age now that's easy to do).

THE GOOD? It's got loads of great humour in it for starters. Including lots of little side shows like rescuing a woman from undead, and then hearing her berate her husband later for sending someone out to rescue her and nagging at him about his marriage vows. Seriously plenty of funny moments. It's nice it doesn't take itself too seriously as a game.

The other big plus is the quests are a little better than your average find this, go here, get this quests. There are lots of optional quests, you can ignore them (but you won't level enough if you do, so make sure you do a few). Fortunately many are interesting and entertaining enough to be reasonably worth the time.

The skill system also is decent I guess - you can build any way you want. Just don't go shoving 1 point in everything - you'll suck.

THE BAD? Well, there's a few issues. The first one is one of those annoyances that makes you want to punch stuff - whenever you are in a dialogue screen and then come out of it into combat, even if you had your weapons drawn, they are now sheathed. And it takes ages to pull them out. While you are fumbling aimlessly (even though you had them out before the chat), you are getting wailed on. In some fights that can matter. It's dumb. It's unnecessary, and bloody frustrating.

RPG games are often made or broken on the use of quest logs, maping markers etc. This game falls WELL short in that dept. It's HARD remembering where you did something to get back there once you've got the thing you were after...  - you can't make a quest active with a marker to help you out, and unless you are truly anal, you won't bother with writing notes to help yourself. This bit really does suck. It makes the game frustrating at times. You run around trying to remember which place to go back to to close out parts of the story. Poor. Annoying. A bad oversight.

Like I said at the start - it's ok. I've played worse RPGs. I've played better though - quite a few better ones...

First time I played this I was tripping hard on acid. Good lord what an amazing night that was. One of my favorite and one of the most underrated RPGs out there. Original release was rocky and it left a bad taste in the mouth of gamers so they avoided the remastered Developers cut...but I'm telling you right now, it's worth it. I have hundreds of hours in this game (I have no idea why Steam only shows 1.4, kinda mad about that actually!). Biggest downside is the dragon segments can get slightly repetitive, but not terribly, just mix up your strategy a bit and you won't even notice. It's also not 100% open world, with some linear paths, but this game pulls it off nicely and the environments never get repetitive.

But even if you aren't like me and don't find this one of the best action RPGs out there, it's still absolutely worth playing.

And I do want to emphasize this isn't one of the best ever in the sense that Witcher 3 is, where it's just a damn good game. It is pretty darn good, but there is a charm to Divinity II that will keep you wanting more. This game, though not perfect, just feels...right.

reviewText: A pretty decent action RPG with some unusual features. Ground combat works perfectly fine and is satisfying, but by the time you're able to turn into a dragon on command, you'll be so powerful in human form that turning into a giant, fire breathing death lizard feels like a step down. I dunno how they managed to have being a dragon make you feel /more/ vulnerable, but they did it. You don't have all the armor and weapon bonuses you've been stacking up when you transform, so it'll take some time to adjust to the increased difficulty of the flying segments at times. Still, there's plenty of loot to be found, a killer rabbit, and you can be an absolute backstabbing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ if you want to. Gotta love multiple choice dialog. I recomend getting Divinity 2 when it's on sale, it's a good game but not the best of it's kind on Steam.
